title: Job Fair
description: Dunder-Mifflin participates in a high school job fair, but few students are interested. Jim, Andy, and Kevin play a round of golf with a prospective client. Back at the office, everyone but Dwight and Angela leave for the day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Ready? Come on, show me excited!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes. [small fist-pumps from both Pam and Oscar.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm pretty excited too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today I'm heading over to the job fair at Valley View High School, to find some new interns. Want to get some fresh blood. Um, euthanize this place.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, are we doing this thing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, Darryl, you look like Barack Obama. Everybody I'm dating Barack Obama!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are you dressed like that?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [in a dress shirt and tie] Like what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like you're applying for a loan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe he's going to church. Or court.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Figured I look presentable. [looks Michael over] You? [Michael dressed casually in jeans and sneakers] Went a different way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Darryl] I think you look nice.

quotes.speaker: {Michael} and {Darryl}
quotes.text: [simultaneously] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here's what we're going to do:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Today, I am meeting a potential client on the golf course, because Ryan put me on probation. You remember Ryan, he was the temp here. Yeah. And uh, it is not a good time for me to lose my job. Since I have some pretty big long term plans in my personal life with Pam, that I'd like her parents to be psyched about. So I am about to do something very bold at this job that I've never done before. Try.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: [takes golf swing] Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mr. Maguire, it's been a couple of years.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Hey Jim, how are you, nice to see you man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh no!  No, no-no-no-no! My grandfather would be spinning in his urn, if he knew that I was out here with a Dartmouth boy. You take that shirt off right now or I will take it off for you, sir.  I am... totally and completely kidding! [they both laugh] Andrew Bernard, Cornell '95.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Phil Maguire, Dartmouth, '74 [goes to shake Andy's hand]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oop, got some blisties.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Yeah, you do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hit about 1200 balls last night, in preparation for today, so hands are a little tender. [shows blisters on both hands] It's actually not funny at all. It's incredibly painful.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Let's make it interesting, say, uh, ten bucks a hole?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What are we talking? Skins? Acey Duecy? Bingo bango bongo? Sandies, Barkies? Arnies, Wolf? What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm gonna take this petty cash I got from Oscar, and turn it into next month's rent.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So many memories in this old gym. Pretending I have PMS so I didn't have to play volleyball, pretending I have PMS so I didn't have to play basketball. Those were the days!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Darryl approaches as students throw basketballs] A little over the top, don't you think?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Show them what you brought, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [holds up single sheet of paper] Um, that's all we brought.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is all we need.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We'll see.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes we will see Oscar, we will see, because a blank sheet of paper equals endless possibilities! Conceptual! All right! We. Are. Open for business! [all four of them sit in an empty booth with small Dunder Mifflin sign]  Hello!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy, you're up, let's go!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [gushing lotion inside his golf gloves] Giddy up, let's do this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: People assume I'm great at golf. But like everybody, I hated golf lessons when I was a kid. So, I used to hang out at the sailing club instead. Got my "knot" on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [swings] Dammit!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Guys, do we have to stay all day?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I mean, Michael's gone, can't we just go?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yeah, and I finished my work months ago!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me, people. It has come to my attention, some of you have forgotten, who is in charge here. When Michael is gone... Jim is in charge. When Jim is gone, Andy and I are in charge. When Andy is gone you answer to me. Okay? [Stanley gets up to go] Excuse me where do you think you're going? Oh no, no, no. You're not leaving. No! Stanley, do not walk out that door! If you walk out that door, so help me, I will - [Stanley leaves] He left. Last time I checked, the American workday ends at five pm. You will all stay at your desks until that time. Or, you will suffer the consequences.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What consequences?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will tell on you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's some filing, restocking the supply shelves. Replacing the water jug, which nobody likes to do. Um, we... uh, eat a lot of cake!

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] Yeah, and uh, you basically learn how an office runs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello. Hi. [to Pam] Can I talk to you for a sec? Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is Michael, my boss. [she points] Justin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, uh, remember what we talked about, in the car on the way up, "only the best and the brightest."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's nice and he seems interested.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He's totally wrong, Pam. [to Justin] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How you doing? Listen, I don't think that a handsome, funny, smart, funny-looking kid like you, should limit himself. You could do whatever you want to do. You could be a classy janitor, or a cashier with dignity, or a... migraine worker. [takes back the info flyer Justin holds] Maybe for you, paper should be more of a hobby.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Sorry for wasting your time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no problem. [looks down] And he signed!  He put his name on the piece of - okay, that was supposed to be a blank canvas on which to put their hopes and dreams. And he just, made it into a stupid piece of paper. We need another one, immediately.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, the booth is lame without it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I only brought the one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you mental?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, do you remember, you specifically told me to only bring one sheet of paper? You said it only takes one sheet to make a difference. And I said, "Are you sure Michael?" And you said "Pam! Pam! Pam!" And then you sneezed in my tea, and then you said, "Don't worry, it's just allergies." Do you remember that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I... don't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. I'll go look for another one. [she leaves]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that. Is why. I need a smart intern.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, so how's the direct mail business going?

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: I can't complain, people love their junk mail.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now are you getting all your paper from PPC? Or-

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: You know what Jim? I'm not really looking to change things up right now, I just came out here to get out of the office for a little bit, so why don't we just play, okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely, will do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So I guess I'll just... work on my short game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [teen approaches table] Hello there.

quotes.speaker: Kid
quotes.text: What is this company?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well it's funny that you should ask, because it's really more than a company...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin paper.

quotes.speaker: Kid
quotes.text: Thanks. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dammit, Oscar!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm trying to lure these kids into my booth, but uh, kids are very wary about being "lured" these days. Thank you Dateline!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. [hangs up phone, leaves for restroom]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Extension 128.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [over phone] Hiya Pumpkin, it's Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Say, we're gonna ditch this bitch. You in?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Are you out? [Angela hangs up] Pumpkin's out, let's go gang! [they all make a run for the door, Dwight re-enters room with only Angela left]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My old art room. [finds a sheet of blank paper] Oh, maybe it's still here! [looks for her painting] No. No they must have taken it down. Never mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [answers cell] What do you want?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I know you're swamped. I just thought you should know that everyone in the office has left, except for Angela and I. Do not worry though, I have taken down their names, and I have docked them a personal day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who cares? I'm not there, Jim's not there, why should they have to be there?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So... what else is up? [Michael hangs up] Mich-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you! [Pam hands him blank paper] What, what is this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A piece of paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This isn't Dunder Mifflin paper. Some sort of Pendleton crap.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well I think they'll get the spirit of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam-Pam-Pam-Pam-PamPamPamPam! We're dying here. I want you to go back to the office and I want you to get the real stuff. I want you to get ultra white card stock.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. And don't call me Shirley.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Oh! [Phil is stuck in the sand trap] Ah, dammit!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, you can just pick it up, take the triple bogey.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Yeah I'll- I'll get it out. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.  [Maguire keeps swinging]

quotes.speaker: {Angela} and {Dwight}
quotes.text: [silently working] [Pam walks back into office, gets paper out of the copier, shows it "voila" to camera, leaves]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Jim's cellphone rings] AH! Come on, Tuna!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, can't really talk now, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just checking in, how's it going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, you know, we'll see, we'll see.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just drove twenty miles round-trip back to the office to get Michael a single sheet of white paper. So, I could have just had them fax it to me, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I like you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Talk to you later?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. All right. Bye. [Kevin sinks putt] All right. Sorry, I got to annoy you one more time. What if I bring down shipping costs?

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: You can try. But I've looked at your prices. Even with free shipping? Doesn't work. It's just- it's not in the stars, Jim. [Phil sinks putt] Six.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, race to the next hole! [he runs off to the cart]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh! Winner gets ten bucks! Wait -wait for me! Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Shortcut! Shortcut! [drives cart off course, it flips over]  Woah! I fell in the sandtrap!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [hums at copier, Angela waiting behind him]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All of these jobs? Suck. I would rather live jobless, on a beach somewhere, off the money from a large inheritance, than to have to work in any one of these crap-holes. They suck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! [walks up to Oscar and Darryl tossing basketballs, grabs Oscar's ball] Game over. [kicks the ball up to the gymnasium ceiling]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singsong] Just-in time.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just-in case. What's your last name?

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Polznik.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This... just in. Justin Polznik! Huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Justin is the ugly girl in the movie, who takes off her glasses and she's hot!  And you realize she was always hot, she was just wearing glasses. And that you were the blind one. He's the most... important thing in my life right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to meet my family. Come on. Oscar Martinez. Accountant extraordinaire. This is Justin.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is Darryl Philbin. Isn't he big? And you already met her, Pam Beesly, office hottie. She will "do" you. [laughs] No, no. But she has already dated two guys in the office, that we know of, so, this could be number three, you never know?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come here. I would never say this to her face, but she is a wonderful person and a gifted artist.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why, why wouldn't you say that to her face?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, what do you think? Think these guys are nice? The guys I didn't bring are even better. Justin, I'm willing to commit right now. Would you do me the honor, of spending the summer with us, at Dunder Mifflin? I think, I think you are very special.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: You didn't want me before. That's what you said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I didn't. You misconstrued me.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: You were kind of a jerk to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, uh, hmm.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: And I'm, I'm gonna go now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't... hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [trying to pick up a beer bottle with blistered hands, struggles trying to take a drink as everyone watches.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [tries to stop a sneeze] Ah-choo!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Bless you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. [Angela turns to look at him.]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, Jim, you owe me one-twenty, and Phil, you owe me two-thirty.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Let's open a tab, because you and me are gonna be playing more often.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Count me in!

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. You had some fun, and uh, I think I paid for it. So let me get my last shot in there. Is there anything you can do for me?

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: I'll tell you what. My fiscal year ends in two months, let's talk then. Sound good?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Good playing with you guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know it's a tough thing, seeing a grown man take six shots to get out of a sand trap but, I had to give Phil credit for not quitting. Which is what I told him. I also told him I don't quit either, and I'd call him every single day until he gave me his business. Which he then did, after ...fifteen minutes of me blocking his car. So I am now his paper supplier! And I shot a 102 today, so I'm feeling pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Woman on mic
quotes.text: The job fair will be closing in five minutes. Eighth period will commence as scheduled.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hold down the fort, I have to do something. [walks up to microphone] Excuse me. If you can hear me, I'd like you to look around at all these companies and know that none of them are good enough for you. H&R Block? Come on, I mean I don't even know what they do. Frank Regan Funeral Home? Too much formaldehyde! The Air Force? [Airforce recruiter glares at Michael] Air Force is cool. The refreshments? Bush league! You know, that's not what you want. Dunder- they,  well, okay I see security is coming so I just want to say, come to Dunder Mifflin. Dunder Mifflin, a great place to work! Anybody? Show of hands, anybody want to intern at Dunder Mifflin?  We do not offer college credit, we cannot give you any sort of pay, but it is a really fun work environment. Anybody? Show of hands? Damn... it. Okay, I'm gonna wrap it up here. Thank you for your time, and drive safe.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Dwight and Angela exiting, he opens door for her] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [clink of beer bottles] Beers? You closed it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I closed it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes! Oh! [runs into his arms, kisses him] Um, congratulations to you, sir. [they shake hands business-like]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you. Oh, thank you very much. Appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you. You know what, screw this! [pulls Pam into a big smooch]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oooh!  [Kevin and Andy add suggestive "bow-chicka-wow-wow" vocals]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today I did something stupid. I questioned myself. And I will never do that again. Because I look at somebody like Jim Halpert and I think, that guy can do anything he wants to do. He could do anything, and he chooses to work here, selling paper. Just like me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [standing way too close to Jim and Pam] Yeah, kiss her. Kiss her good. [Jim and Pam stop kissing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was just wondering, what kind of jobs do you guys have?

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: Are you interested in graphic design?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Can I fill out an application?

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: Oh absolutely, here, take a seat. I should let you know right away, this is just an entry-level job. It's really basic. We're looking for like, a self starter, someone who can meet deadlines, who just pretty much just go the extra mile, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can do that.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: Great. And uh, obviously looking for someone who knows Photoshop, and Dreamweaver. Uh, Corel Painter, Illustrator, AfterEffects, all the basics.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know any of those.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: [laughs] It's actually not super-complicated. I mean I'm sure there's some sort of like, adult education classes in the area. But if you're really serious about graphic design, one thing about New York or Philadelphia, they've got amazing programs out there for design.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: New York or Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: All right. Cool, well... thanks.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And uh, I'll look into those.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: You should.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: New York or Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Graphics Guy
quotes.text: It's where the action is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, kids today have a very short attention span.  They are into texting and video games and sex, and they just, they get distracted easily.  And today they're being distracted by the other booths.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] Hey, there!  Michael Scott, regional manager, Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Brad Bailey, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is a very firm handshake.  Ow, ow, aahch!  Killing my hand, there.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, what is your poison?  You like uh, sales, accounting, customer service, what do you like...

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Sales, uh, sales would be cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sales is and could be very, very cool.  If you like paper, and you love to laugh, this is the place for you.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Well, that's great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right here.  We have a lot of fun.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Pam returns] This is one of our staff.  This is Pam Beesly, [takes piece of paper from Pam] receptionist extraordinaire.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Hey, Pam, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check that out, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pretty nice.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She sits there all day.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You get to look at her.  Why don't you hold out your hand. [hands Brad paper] Tell me what you feel.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's called card stock.  That's what you're feeling.  Now what you're feeling inside is confusion, butterflies, exhilaration... You're thinking, "Am I good enough for this job?  Do I have what it takes?"  And I think we both know the answer.  We'll find that out together.  You can keep that.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Sweet. [camera zooms in on Pam]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't fold it, though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have the Dundies, my birthday, those blow out, and it's sexy, it's sort of a sexy atmosphere, you know?  The other day, in the parking lot, I actually found a condom.  So.  [to Pam]  I've been meaning to ask you, do you know whose that was?  [Pam shakes head no]  So, sexy is fun...

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Well, it was nice meeting you, I'm, I'm gonna take off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you know what?  Coincidence - I am going to go for a little stroll myself.  Are you psyched about the summer?

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, me, too.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Okay, well, I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, be my guest.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And do your worst.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Brad coming out of the bathroom] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Whoa, come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, I forgot to mention that my old temp is now my boss, so, gives you an idea of how quickly you can move up in this...

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Yeah, I get it, okay, I'm not interested.  Stop following me around; you're really starting to creep me out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One other thing I wanted to...

quotes.speaker: Brad
quotes.text: Nnn, look.  I was just being polite.  I don't want to waste my life selling paper for your stupid company, okay? [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs]  Ohh...Nah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm gonna take so much money off that guy.  That guy is a whale.  I'm gonna clean him out.  This is really gonna get me out of a hole.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He's not my client.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If your client likes Italian food, you bring him to Cugino's.  And if your client likes a little action, you bring him a gambler.  And if your client hates Cornell, you bring him Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [tries to break club over knee] Ow! Ow! [tries again] Owooh!

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: Guy's kind of a douche.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, well, you know...Cornell.

quotes.speaker: Phil Maguire
quotes.text: [chuckling] I guess.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Justin!

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: I'm sorry, I'm sort of in the middle of this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, you want this kid to be in the Air Force?

quotes.speaker: Air Force Recruiter
quotes.text: Absolutely.  Justin is smart, capable, ambitious, and he aims high.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Time out.  You think this kid could be a fighter pilot?

quotes.speaker: Air Force Recruiter
quotes.text: I think Justin can be anything he wants to be.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: [chuckling] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have you given any more thought to Dunder Mifflin?

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Well, you took away the brochure, so I sort of...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah, but you don't need the brochure.  The brochure is up here [indicates head] and it's in here. [indicates heart]

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you are smart, and capable, and you aim high.

quotes.speaker: Justin
quotes.text: That's what the recruiter just said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm right.
